intro: Cyathula distorta, commonly known as the distorted spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or marshy areas. Cyathula distorta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
